item.title: Desco Infratech Secures Rs. 9.38 Crore Order from Gujarat Gas Limited
item.description: Top News Desco Infratech Secures Rs. 9.38 Crore Order from Gujarat Gas Limited 43 minutes ago Desco Infratech Limited has received a new purchase order worth Rs. 9.38 crore from Gujarat Gas Limited for PNG installations and operations & maintenance activities in Surat and Valsad areas. The order includes PNG installations in Cluster 3C-Utran, Mota Varachha City Area, and Velenja Surrounding Area of Surat GA, as well as PE-PNG Operations & Maintenance Activity at Sarigam Surrounding area Cluster in Valsad GA. This order strengthens Desco Infratech's position in the city gas distribution segment and maintains their order book above Rs. 370 crores.

item.title: Marsons Ltd Secures BWR BBB-/Stable Rating, Reports Significant Revenue Growth
item.description: Marsons Ltd Secures BWR BBB-/Stable Rating, Reports Significant Revenue Growth 1 hour ago Marsons Ltd, a transformer manufacturer, has been assigned a BWR BBB-/Stable rating for long-term and BWR A2 for short-term bank facilities by Brickwork Ratings. The rating applies to Rs 35 crore facilities from ICICI Bank. The company reported significant financial growth in FY 2025, with revenue increasing by 2490.77% to Rs 168.40 crore and net profit rising by 4566.67% to Rs 28.00 crore. Marsons Ltd currently has an order book of approximately Rs 294 crores and is the only manufacturer in Eastern India capable of producing transformers of 132 kV class and above. Despite strong performance, the company faces challenges including working capital intensity, raw material price volatility, and industry competition.

item.title: AIA Engineering's Subsidiary Completes 70% Acquisition of Australian Mining Company VMPS
item.description: AIA Engineering's Subsidiary Completes 70% Acquisition of Australian Mining Company VMPS 1 minute ago AIA Engineering's subsidiary, Vega Industries (Middle East) FZC, has acquired an additional 14% stake in VEGA MPS PTY LIMITED (VMPS), an Australian mining liner specialist, for AUD 5.64 million (approx. INR 30.85 crore). This increases their total stake to 70%. VMPS brings expertise in mining liner design, supply, process engineering, and project management. The acquisition aligns with AIA Engineering's strategy to strengthen its global mining liner business position.

item.title: Meesho's Strong Market Debut: Shares List at 45% Premium on BSE
item.description: Meesho's Strong Market Debut: Shares List at 45% Premium on BSE 4 hours ago Meesho made a strong debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with its shares listing at ₹161.20, a 45% premium over the issue price of ₹111.00. The listing price represents a gain of ₹50.20 per share for IPO investors. This robust performance indicates positive investor sentiment towards Meesho's business model and the growing e-commerce sector in India.
